title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a refundable personal credit for energy conservation expenditures, and for other purposes.
content: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an annual residential energy credit of up to $2,000 for qualifying conservation expenditures. Directs the Secretary of Energy to establish the Elementary and Secondary School Energy Efficiency and Conservation Program to provide grants to local educational agencies to retrofit schools for increased energy conservation. Requires electric utility company billing statements to provide peak and nonpeak hour energy use and rate information.
